Same happens when pressing "Add Type".

Furthermore, the format of the pref_store.ini seems to have changed between M4 
and M5. So, even if you had custom tasks defined in M4, they don't work in M5 -
 and due to the UI bug you can't add them.
*** Bug 47309 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
This is a result of the changes for bug 25590.

>>Furthermore, the format of the pref_store.ini seems to have changed between 
>>M4 and M5.
I do not believe that this is true. If it is then we need to fix it. Can you 
please file a separate bug report with an attached pref_store.ini and test 
case so I can address any problems. Thanks.
Bug 47311 has attachments for pref_store.ini from M4 and M5.

Created an attachment (id=6922)
Replacement plugin for org.eclipse.ant.ui

Replace the org.eclipse.ant.ui plugin with those contained in this zip patch.

Yo mon (as we say here in Jamaica) - the replacement works perfect!

Thanks for the great Sunday afternoon work ...

No problem...sorry for the trouble in the first place :-)
With the "de" domain I assumed you were in Germany working away on a Sunday 
evening. Eclipse users are everywhere...

Thx the really fast response and the fix, but this fix works only with fresh
install.
When,i want use the defined tasks, i need run in same JRE with the workspace.

But WORKS!

THX again!

Darin,

I see the same effect as ]-[appy - using custom tasks works in same JRE, but 
so far not in a different JRE.

By the way, I am German, but I live and work (thanks to the Internet) in 
Jamaica. And yes, I work in the night as well ...

Thanks again for the quick fix!
The bug for the tasks/types in a different VM is bug 47312.
*** Bug 47311 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Fixed in AddCustomDialog, and the AntPage hierarchy.
*** Bug 47889 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Another thanks again for this patch!
